security_audit.summary: Legitimate WordPress SEO audit tool with necessary external commands for Docker and network access. Contains SQL injection vulnerability in database queries that requires patching. Hardcoded credentials are present but for local dev only.

high_findings.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
high_findings.description: Database queries use f-string interpolation without sanitization, allowing SQL injection attacks if user-controlled input reaches post_id. At line 53-62, the query directly interpolates post_id: 'WHERE post_id = {post_id}'. An attacker controlling page data could inject SQL. Code: query = f"SELECT meta_key, meta_value FROM wp_postmeta WHERE post_id = {post_id} AND meta_key IN..."

medium_findings.title: Hardcoded Database Credentials
medium_findings.description: Database credentials are hardcoded in plain text at lines 25-28: DB_PASS = "wordpress". While these appear to be local dev credentials, hardcoded credentials are a security anti-pattern that could be exploited if this code runs in production.

low_findings.title: Command Injection Surface
low_findings.description: The script executes subprocess.run with shell=False (lines 34-39, 94-99), which is the safer approach. However, the docker exec command includes password on command line, exposing it in process listings. Consider using environment variables or stdin for password passing.

content.user_title: Audit and Fix WordPress SEO Issues
content.value_statement: WordPress pages often have missing meta descriptions, unfocused keywords, or no featured images. This skill audits all pages and posts against SEO best practices, identifies issues, and provides specific recommendations to improve search rankings.
actual_capabilities: Audit all WordPress pages and posts for SEO completeness
Check focus keyword presence and placement
Validate meta description length and keyword inclusion
Verify featured image presence and metadata
Generate actionable audit reports with scores
limitations: Does not modify WordPress content directly
Requires WordPress REST API or database access
Does not track ranking changes over time
Cannot access password-protected or private content

use_cases.title: Site SEO Audit
use_cases.description: Run comprehensive SEO audits on client WordPress sites before launch

use_cases.title: Content Optimization
use_cases.description: Check existing pages for missing meta descriptions and focus keywords

use_cases.title: SEO Health Check
use_cases.description: Identify pages with poor SEO scores and prioritize fixes

prompt_templates.title: Full Site Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a complete SEO audit on our WordPress site. Check every page for focus keywords, meta descriptions, and featured images. Generate a report showing pages that need attention.

prompt_templates.title: Single Page Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the SEO status of the about page. What is the focus keyword? Is the meta description present and optimal length? Does it have a featured image with proper alt text?

prompt_templates.title: Missing Elements Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all pages missing focus keywords, all pages without meta descriptions, and all pages without featured images. Prioritize by importance.

prompt_templates.title: Meta Description Fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all meta descriptions. Flag any that are too short, too long, or missing the focus keyword. Provide the exact word count for each.

output_examples.input: Run SEO audit on our WordPress site
output: About page: Focus keyword 'real estate Miami' present - in title and description
Meta description: 156 characters (optimal), contains focus keyword
Featured image: Present but ALT text missing keyword
Portfolio page: No focus keyword set
Recommendations: Add focus keyword 'Miami properties', write meta description 120-160 chars, add featured image

best_practices: Set one focus keyword per page that matches user search intent
Keep meta descriptions between 120-160 characters for optimal display
Include focus keyword in title, meta description, and image alt text
Add a featured image to every page with descriptive alt text
anti_patterns: Using multiple focus keywords per page dilutes SEO effectiveness
Keyword stuffing meta descriptions harms user experience and rankings
Leaving featured images without alt text misses accessibility and SEO opportunities
Setting focus keywords that do not match actual page content

faq.question: Which WordPress SEO plugins are supported?
faq.answer: Yoast SEO and Rank Math are fully supported. The skill reads plugin-specific meta keys from the database.

faq.question: How many pages can be audited at once?
faq.answer: The skill processes pages in batches of 100 via the WordPress REST API. Large sites will take longer to complete.

faq.question: How does this integrate with WordPress?
faq.answer: The skill connects via WordPress REST API or direct database queries to read SEO metadata stored by Yoast or Rank Math.

faq.question: Is my WordPress data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only reads data from your WordPress site. No content is modified without explicit user request.

faq.question: Why did the audit fail to connect?
faq.answer: Check that your WordPress site has the REST API enabled. The site must be accessible from where Claude is running.

faq.question: How is this different from online SEO tools?
faq.answer: This tool reads directly from your WordPress database for accurate results. Online tools only see public page source code.
